chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
This chapter teaches how the Father glorifies the Son. The Son also glorifies the Father, as the Gospel records the Son speaking to the Father: "I have glorified you on earth." The Son further says: "Father, glorify your Son, so that your Son may glorify you."

The Holy Spirit also glorifies the Son, as it's written: "He will glorify me, because he will receive from what is mine and announce it to you." If the Holy Spirit glorifies the Son, then the Holy Spirit is never greater than the Son.

The Son himself says in the Psalm: "The sacrifice of praise will honor me." Thus, the sacrifice of praise represents the burnt offering of suffering; in suffering, the man is glorified, for God is always glorious.

Do you want to understand that the Son has always been glorious and is the God of glory? The Apostle Paul mentions regarding the Jews: "For if they had known, they would never have crucified the Lord of glory."

Therefore, the one who could die could also be glorified, but only as a man. Listen to what the Son himself says about sanctifying himself: "In truth, saying, I sanctify myself."
chunks.original_latin:
Quomodo clarificet Pater Filium, sic docetur. Nam
et Filius clarificat Patrem, sicut scriptum est in Evangelio
dicente ipso Filio ad Patrem: Ego te clarificavi
super terram. Iterum ipse Filius dicit: Pater, clarifica
Filium tuum, ut et Filius tuus clarificet te. Et ipse
Spiritus sanctus clarificat Filium, quia scriptum est:
Ipse me clarificabit, quia de meo accipiet, et annuntiabit
vobis. Si ergo clarificat Spiritus sanctus Filium,
 nunquam major est Filio Spiritus sanctus. Et ipse
Filius dicit in psalmo: Sacrificium laudis honorificabit
me. Ergo sacrificium laudis holocaustum passionis
accipitur; in passione ergo clarificatur homo, nam
Deus semper est gloriosus. Vis scire quia non solum
semper gloriosus fuit Filius, sed et Deus gloriae fuit et
est, apostolus Paulus dicit de Judaeis: Si enim cognovissent,
nunquam Dominum gloriae crucifixissent. Nunc
ergo qui mori potuit, ipse et glorificari potuit, homo
tantum. Nam audi quid dicat ipse Filius, quomodo se
ipse sanctificat: In veritate, dicens, sanctifico meipsum.
